intro: Lychniothyrsus mollis, commonly known as the soft thorned everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has slender, branched stems and produces small, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Lychniothyrsus mollis is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and delicate appearance.
